title.narrative: Office of Child Labor, Forced Labor, and Human Trafficking (OCFT) - Project to Promote Workplace-Based Training for Vulnerable Youth in Argentina

description.narrative: To help bridge the skills gap in Argentina by increasing the number and quality of on-the-job training programs, such as internships and apprenticeships, while ensuring these opportunities are accessible to the youth who need them the most.

title.narrative: Multi-stakeholder Strategy for Child Labor Elimination in Agriculture in Argentina

description.narrative: This project seeks to raise the visibility and understanding of child labor in agriculture in Argentina and contribute to improving the tools and coordination among government entities, the private sector, and civil society to confront the problem.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Improving the Capacity of Labor and Agriculture Stakeholders to Address Child Labor in Agricultural Areas of Argentina Project

description.narrative: This project works to build the capacity of labor and agriculture stakeholders to more effectively implement the National Action Plan on Child Labor and coordinate efforts to combat child labor. It utilizes existing structures at the national, provincial, and municipal levels to expand coordination to reduce the risk that children will be harmed by performing hazardous work in agriculture.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
